isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 11. Main Power Relay to ECM

svcprocinfo.para: To determine correct power supplied to operate the ECM
The ECM requires 7 V minimum for correct operation.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Measurement with Breakout Harness at Main Power Relay

item.para: Relay Breakout Harness
DMM

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: Batteries must be fully charged before doing the following steps.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to OFF and ensure all accessories are turned off.

figure.caption: Relay Breakout Harness to power distribution center

step1.para: Connect Relay Breakout Harness between ECM main power relay and power distribution center or chassis harness depending on application.

note.para: Depending on application, the relay could be one of two kinds. Check power distribution center or cab cowl.

step1.para: Connect DMM POS to lead 87 and NEG to ground terminal on cowl.
Crank engine for 20 seconds and measure voltage.
Record the lowest voltage on Diagnostic Form.

item.para:
If the voltage is below 7 V, the ECM main power relay may be resetting, due to low voltage and current from the batteries, or problems in the ignition circuit and power feed circuits. See Electronic Control Module Power (ECM PWR)
in Section 7 .
If the voltage is above 7 V, continue with Hard Start and No Start Diagnostic tests.

note.para: Results can be above 7 V, but there may be a problem between the main power relay and the ECM. If a Hard Start / No Start problem remains after all Diagnostic Form tests are complete, do Voltage Measurement at ECM with Breakout Box.

item.para: Failed batteries
High-resistance at battery cable connections
Wiring to the ECM

randlist.title: Low or no battery voltage to the ECM

item.para: High-resistance or an open power feed circuit to the ECM or ECM main power relay.
The ECM power circuit fuse in battery box may be open.
ECM main power relay may have failed.
V IGN circuit problem
Failed ECM

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Measurement at ECM with Breakout Box

note.para: If the breakout box was used to do Test 6 - EST Data List, the following procedures do not have to be done.
Use the following procedures when any of the following situations exist:

item.para: A Relay Breakout Harness is not available
Expected voltages were not to spec, when using the Relay Breakout Harness
Voltages were to spec, using the Relay Breakout Harness and Hard Start No Start Diagnostics is complete - but a concern remains
Breakout Box
Digital Multimeter (DMM)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: Batteries must be fully charged before doing the following steps.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to OFF and ensure all accessories are turned off.
Remove two white connectors (X3 and X4) from ECM.

figure.caption: Engine and chassis breakout box connections

calloutgroup.callout1: Breakout box connector X4 to ECM
Breakout box connector X3 to ECM
Breakout box connector X2 to ECM
Breakout box connector X1 to ECM
Engine wiring harness ECM connector X2 to breakout box header
Engine wiring harness ECM connector X1 to breakout box header
Breakout box header X1 and X2 engine to breakout box
Chassis wiring harness connector to breakout box header
Chassis wiring harness connector to breakout box header
Breakout box header X3 and X4 breakout box to chassis

step1.para: Connect breakout box connectors (X3 and X4) to connections on ECM.
Connect chassis harness connectors to breakout box header (X3 and X4).
Connect leads of the DMM to the following test points on the breakout box:

item.para: POS X3-3 to NEG X3-7 (V IGN Pwr)
POS X4-2 to NEG X3-7 (ECM PWR)
POS X4-1 to NEG X3-7 (ECM PWR)

step1.para: Crank engine for 20 seconds and measure voltage.
Record the lowest voltage on Diagnostic Form.

item.para:
If the voltage is below 7 V, the ECM power relay may be resetting, resulting from low voltage and current from the batteries, or problems in the ignition circuit and power feed circuits. See "ECM PWR, Electronic Control Module Power"
in Section 7 .
If the voltage is above 7 V, continue with Hard Start and No Start Diagnostic tests.
